body:
WeSmart is looking for a senior data scientist to synthesize and leverage our massive dataset of energy data to enhance solution analysis. This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals destined to change the face of energy and IOT data management. We are focused on the company’s agenda, and work on high-impact projects utilizing big data analytics and machine learning to improve energy solutions. We’re a lean, flat and experimental team combining science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into energy management processes at their point of highest impact. The team works in quick iterations, using the techniques and algorithms best suited for solving the challenging problems of energy management.



You will advocate, evangelise and build data-fueled products that help our customers improve energy solutions. You’ll dig in and become an expert on energy and IOT datasets. You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables. You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritise actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas for WeSmart but also for our customers. You will lead applied analytics initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions for energy management. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyse diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes. As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organisation.



You’re passionate about asking and answering questions in large datasets, and you are able to communicate that passion to product managers and engineers. You have a keen desire to solve business problems, and live to find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data. You propose analytics strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around you. You desire a fast paced, test-driven, collaborative and iterative engineering environment. You love learning, data, scale and agility. You excel at making complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you. You’re driven to show the world the power of applied analytics.



Master or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research or any related field A minimum of 4 years of working experience as a data scientist or in analytics Strong programming skills such as Java and/or Python Minimum of 2 years’ experience in machine learning Minimum of 2 years’ experience in team management Knowledge of statistical tools such SAS, R, Matlab, … is required Professional experience in the energy sector is preferred Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong analytical competencies and excellent creative problem-solving skills Fluent in French and English

Are you interested in making significant contributions and Global impact while integrating and analyzing complex, high dimensional data sets for the industry leader? Are you excited about opportunities to extract biological knowledge within Vaccines R&D? If so, GSK’s Data Science and Digital Innovation team is looking for a Senior Data Scientist and this role could be an ideal opportunity to explore.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to ensure data analytics and bioinformatics deliverable for Vaccines R&D projects that are the top of search and industry standards with respect to scientific excellence, quality and timelines.
















Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork in a culture of Innovation, Performance and Trust.

– Our Vaccines business has a broad portfolio and innovative pipeline of vaccines to protect people of all ages. We deliver over two million vaccine doses per day to people living in over 160 countries.

For further information, please visit www.gsk.com.

Patient-focused is the heart of our business. Our R&D department seeks to discover and develop new vaccines, to protect against diseases where vaccines are not yet available and to improve on those vaccines that already exist. Part of our R&D programme targets diseases particularly prevalent in the developing world, including the World Health Organisation’s three priority diseases - HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria. Research into candidate vaccines for other diseases of the developing world, such as dengue are at an earlier stage of development.

When it comes to developing the vaccines of the future, we’re looking for real experts in their respective fields who are interested in working in the stimulating environment of an international healthcare company.

We emphasise the value of teamwork and we look for people ready to share our values of transparency, respect, integrity and patient focus.

If you have a disability and require assistance during the course of the selection process, you will have the opportunity to let us know what specific assistance you require in order to make suitable arrangements.

Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

The department

We, from B&PS Digital Readiness, guide our clients to enable them to make the best out of their digital transformation. We support them in their migration from classical application development into the modern world of Block-chain, virtual reality and Low-Coding.



Our low-code team consists of approximately 40 people, both male and female. The team has been active since 2016 and has a good mix of junior and senior employees. We focus on application development using OutSystems and Mendix. Where we are experienced in the cloud platform as well as the on-premise platform. It’s our aim that each team member is certified. For OutSystems we have people certified at the levels of Associate, Professional and Tech lead. For Mendix we have certifications on the levels rapid developer and advanced developer.

We add value to our customers by secondment, delivery of a team or working by work packages. We deliver new platforms & applications and support the maintenance of it. Where most platform and application support is performed by our certified nearshore Atos colleagues in Russia.

In this dynamic position within Atos you have lots of freedom and responsibility to develop yourself to a higher level with a specialisation in User interface & Front-end or Back-end development. Knowledge-sharing and cooperation across competences is very much encouraged and expected.









Besides challenging and welcoming working environment with global and local people, we offer you




For more information about this position, please contact our Corporate Recruiter, Tanja Smet on +32 (0)493 85 32 87 . Due to the GDPR we kindly ask you to submit your application not via e-mail but via the button below.

Function
As Data Engineer you will interact with the business and IT people (architects, functional analysts, project managers, offshore developers) and participate in the data transformation program.
As part of this program, we are moving our enterprise data platform and Machine Learning solutions to the Microsoft Azure public cloud and in this migration, you will design and develop the optimal extraction, loading and transformation of data from a wide variety of data sources.
Next to this you will be developing data models for the Integration Layer in the Enterprise Data Hub and for the Information Delivery Layer.
You will also be working on several generic frameworks e.g. framework for logging, XML/JSON parser, etc.

For our partner BICS, we are currently looking for aNetwork and Services Data Engineer.

body:
Job Description

CONTEXT

We believe that data makes better decisions. During the current data-revolution, we’ve seen multiple technology waves that allow us to execute on this vision. The Internet of Things allows us to measure, Big Data allows us to process and Artificial Intelligence helps us to make sense of it all. These technologies are only tools, that is why we want to invest in people that can . No data staying in stuffy data warehouses, no algorithms running solely on the laptops of data scientists, but insights delivered to actual decision makers in a clear way through reports, websites and apps. We take end-to-end responsibility in creating, delivering and running these products. We do this in an agile way, creating products that provide clear value to their users.

Telenet has a unique position to deliver on this vision with its large customer base, strong brand and IoT-enabled network. Being a larger company, we need people that are able to create value through collaboration and see challenge in the multitude of our product landscape. As a Data Engineer, you will become part of a team of motivated people, making decisions better through data.

If this sounds like a nice proposition, here is what you should have in store for us and what we will offer you.

ROLE





PROFILE












At the Information Technology Department, we embrace digital possibilities and are always ready to make it happen. We make a difference by choosing change and leading-edge innovation in digital and data technology that provides solutions for internal and external customers. The impact of our work is huge, no matter how small it starts.

The Big Data Consultant advises organizations about big data, big data strategies, the implementation of big data, which technologies best fit the needs of the organization and even implements the selected big data solution. A big data consultant therefore should have business experience as well as sound technical knowledge of a broad range of big data tools.





Additional Information

Cowboy is a Belgian startup that is developing innovative electric bikes for urban riders. Cowboy’s main goal is to improve urban mobility and take commuters to their destination in a more enjoyable, sustainable and efficient manner.

Founded in 2017 by entrepreneurs Adrien Roose, Karim Slaoui and Tanguy Goretti, Cowboy is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium. Cowboy is the winner of the Eurobike 2017, the Red-Dot bicycle design award 2018 and the Red-Dot “Best of the Best” award for the Cowboy 2.

With traffic congestion plaguing metropolitan areas, electric bikes are proving to be the fastest means of transportation, beating cars and ground public transport. Cowboy’s vision is to elevate the daily commute to the next level in terms of speed, comfort and freedom of movement around the city. Cowboy enhances the riding experience by unifying intelligent technology, delightful design and meticulous customer service.

Cowboy raised ten million EUR from international investors (including Index Ventures, Tiger Global and Hardware Club) in the Series A round in autumn 2018 and quickly sold out its entire stock of bikes in Belgium the following year. In April 2019, Cowboy launched its second model, the Cowboy 2, and introduced it to 8 additional countries (Germany, France, the Netherlands, Luxembourg, Austria, Italy, Spain and the United Kingdom). In June 2020, Cowboy unveiled its third generation electric bike, the Cowboy 3.



You will closely work with our Front-End and Back-End developers. You will be reporting directly to the CTO and a good chunk of your work will be to support our internal tools. It will be quite interesting as we are facing many complex challenges in logistics, remote repairs, distribution (test rides available in 60+ cities), manufacturing, data warehousing, testing, etc.

You will be talking to many people in the company to make sure we can reach our targets and take the company to the next level.

It's definitely not your classic marketplace / SaaS development.

Senior/Expert Data Scientist – M/F/X

Want to help shape the bank of tomorrow today?

At the bank for a changing world, our employees make change their greatest asset, turning challenges into opportunities. They think ahead to offer our customers creative solutions which are perfectly suited to their needs. At BNP Paribas Fortis, the country’s number one bank, employees enjoy ongoing career growth in a meaningful, rewarding and flexible working environment.

The A&AI tribe (Analytics & Artificial Intelligence) has the objective of transforming data into valuable information to improve business. We are looking for someone with a strong understanding of the challenges related to this field to join our team.





As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to apply and develop your skills in several domains

The A& AI tribe is looking for a Senior Data Scientist (seniority rhymes with knowledge and experience) with a proven track record in the field of Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence and innovation.





You take pride in the following knowledge and experience that you have already acquired, which are indispensable for this role.

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values. At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain women and men of all ages, from all backgrounds, each with her or his own experience. We truly believe that diversity increases performance and creativity. All our offers for full-time positions are also available for 90% or 80% full-time equivalent.



We believe that our evolution is driven and inspired by our employees. In return, we aim to provide optimal working conditions that enable you to develop on both a professional and personal level. We offer a challenging working environment in which you are going to have a real impact within our company. You can actively shape your benefit package to respond to your individual needs.



Passionate about this role? Do not hesitate to apply online: we’d love to hear from you!

Standard / Permanent



DATA

At least 3 years



Full-time

Business users gain rapid access to data for meaningful analysis, while the enterprise can also overlay appropriate processes to ensure policies are adhered to, mitigating potential liabilities from privacy regulations.

You'll share responsibility from beginning to end to deliver excellent quality software:

job title: Second Line Support Engineer equensWorldline BE (F/M)
body:
equensWorldline is one of the leading and most innovative payment service providers in Europe. As experts in financial processing and software licensing we provide services to fulfill all needs of the dynamic European payments market. Innovation is high on our agenda, as the payments industry is rapidly evolving. That’s why we foster the development of new and innovative solutions, such as instant payments, contactless payments, mobile payment solutions and digital identity services, allowing our clients to cater for the shifting needs and increasing demands of their customers. Each year we process billions of payments, point-of-sale and ATM transactions. Obviously, all those transactions must be processed seamlessly, securely and efficiently. And that’s what we do.

Being a central pillar of the Worldline Group, it’s our ambition to support our clients in keeping up with the rapidly shifting needs and increasing demands of their customers. A challenging job, as the European payments market – and therefore also our organization – is subject to continuous change. equensWorldline is a truly European company with office locations in multiple countries and a broad, international client base in numerous countries across Europe.



Are you up for the challenge to join the team of men and women who feel passionately about their work, focusing on achieving their assignments and making every effort to give their best at all times to those who trust them? Do you want to join the team that manages Belgium’s biggest real-time network, 7 days a week, 24 hours a day?

equensWorldline is looking for an to join the Operations & Support Service within our Operations IT team. We offer our new joiners, bachelors and masters, a motivating employment environment and a wide variety of projects and clients to work for.



The Operations & Support Service is providing high-quality technical assistance for the real-time payment authorization applications. We manage incidents and problems reporting through a central queue of tickets. The main goal of the Service is to guarantee the availability, the robustness and efficiency of the applications in our real-time production environment. We help to define the specific maintenance needed to be included in projects in order to keep our system powerful and upgraded. Besides, assistance is given to the development team for providing production data for test purposes. We participate in the Risk Based Testing approach and in project or change analysis to improve the operability of our system.

People seeking careers as Operations & Application Engineer within equensWoldline will be responsible for providing commitment to a production team through communication, inspiration and motivation as well as monitoring, troubleshooting and maintaining all our products. Along with the primary responsibilities, the Operations & Application Engineer will be involved with the rest of the team members focusing online balancing, capacity management and making necessary design improvements to eliminate unplanned downtime due to technical problems in order to achieve a maximum of productivity.

We are very interested in individuals who have a track record of finding creative solutions to unique and complex problems, and who will thrive in challenging situations. Having a high sense of responsibility, is one of your major qualities.

Incident management requires analytical and solution driven skills. You work both independently and in a team environment. As a team player you share your knowledge with your team members.

You will demonstrate the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and manage changing priorities. In the production environment you work organized, orderly, are flexible and you are willing to work outside the normal business hours on exceptional occasions. You are occasionally willing to work under high pressure and in these circumstances you stay calm and diplomatic in order to be as helpful as possible.

Operations & Application Engineer may be required, after practical training, to be on-call on a rotating basis throughout the year to provide a workaround to solve issues. This entry level engineering position gives you the experience and knowledge of our production authorization system.

The Operations & Application Engineer will join an established team and will be responsible for the following tasks:










Brussels (Belgium)


Our culture is informal. Within our company, teamwork and clarity are very important, as well as customer-focus and a result-oriented approach. And of course…pleasure in our work! We work closely together with our colleagues in the different countries. English is our common language. As a result you really experience that you are part of a European, international company.


If you wish to apply for this position, please click below to complete our online application form and attach your CV in either Word, rtf or text format.
equensWorldline does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, age, disability or sexual orientation. All recruitment decisions are based solely on qualifications, skills, knowledge and experience and relevant business requirements.
We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the applications process for people with disabilities.

Engineer, Middleware, Linux, Database, SQL, Engineering, Technology

Site Name: Belgium-Rixensart
Posted Date: May 4 2020

Are you interested in making significant contributions and Global impact by integrating and analyzing complex, high dimensional data sets while coaching and mentoring Data Scientists for the industry leader ? Are you excited about opportunities to extract biological knowledge from data and use it in Vaccines R&D projects? If so, GSK’s Data Science and Digital Innovation team is looking for a Senior Manager Data Scientist and this role could be an ideal opportunity to explore.

As a Senior Manager Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to ensure that data analytics and bioinformatics deliverables for a portfolio of Vaccines R&D projects are at the top of industry standards with respect to scientific excellence, quality and timelines.
















Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork in a culture of Innovation, Performance and Trust.

– Our Vaccines business has a broad portfolio and innovative pipeline of vaccines to protect people of all ages. We deliver over two million vaccine doses per day to people living in over 160 countries.

For further information, please visit www.gsk.com.

Patient-focused is the heart of our business. Our R&D department seeks to discover and develop new vaccines, to protect against diseases where vaccines are not yet available and to improve on those vaccines that already exist. Part of our R&D programme targets diseases particularly prevalent in the developing world, including the World Health Organisation’s three priority diseases - HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria. Research into candidate vaccines for other diseases of the developing world, such as dengue are at an earlier stage of development.

When it comes to developing the vaccines of the future, we’re looking for real experts in their respective fields who are interested in working in the stimulating environment of an international healthcare company.

We emphasise the value of teamwork and we look for people ready to share our values of transparency, respect, integrity and patient focus.

If you have a disability and require assistance during the course of the selection process, you will have the opportunity to let us know what specific assistance you require in order to make suitable arrangements.

Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

WeSmart is looking for senior data scientists’ consultants to help our customers to synthesise and leverage their dataset of energy data, using the techniques and algorithms developments best suited for solving the challenging problems of energy management.



Your main mission will consist of working with our customers. You will be building data-fueled products that help our customers to improve energy solutions. This role will engage you with the business by addressing strategic and tactical questions through the use of data analytics and data visualisation analysis. You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions.

You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritise actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas for our customers. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyse diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes. As data scientist, you will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organisation.



You’re passionate about asking and answering questions in large datasets, and you are able to communicate that passion to product managers and engineers. You have a keen desire to solve business problems, and live to find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data. You propose analytics strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around you. You desire a fast paced, test-driven, collaborative and iterative engineering environment. You love learning, data, scale and agility. You excel at making complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you. You’re driven to show the world the power of applied analytics.



Master or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research or any related field A minimum of 4 years of working experience as a data scientist or in analytics Strong programming skills such as Java and/or Python Minimum of 2 years’ experience in machine learning



Knowledge of statistical modelling and data mining is required Knowledge of statistical tools such SAS, R, Matlab, … is required Professional experience in the energy sector is preferred

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong analytical competencies and excellent creative problem-solving skills Fluent in French and English

In a constantly changing world, we work together with our people, clients and communities to enable them to fulfill their potential to do great things. We believe that by bringing everyone together, we can solve problems using innovative technology that can create a world that is sustainable and secure. At NTT, we encourage you to remain continuously curious, as that is what keeps you fast, flexible and relevant. No two days will be the same but that is what will help you grow and realize your full potential.

The power is in your hands to do great things. It’s time to lead the change, be the authentic you, to solve difficult challenges, to set the pace of change and to unleash your potential.


At NTT, we want to invest in the future generation, so you !
That is why one of our priorities is recruiting young people and creating opportunities to grow and learn.

Join our Young Graduate Program !

The Young Graduate Program at NTT combines a permanent job with a training program that aims at developing the skills of Young Grads.

You’ll start your program with a ton of interesting courses, to already upskill your knowledge but also to find out what your cup of tea is and to learn where your strengths lie. Your buddy will coach you to take gradually projects to work on independently.

Not only will you be working alongside experts, you’ll also get a chance to tackle numerous challenges in an ambitious, hi-tech and data-driven working environment.

Job Description

Big data? That’s peanuts for you! With your mega knowledge of Spark, Scala and Kafka Streams, you convert huge data flows into value for customers and shareholders. This means you are able to steer company decisions and boost customer experiences.



As a leading telecommunications company with its two feet in the digitization of our society, Telenet is eager to bring aboard (big) data-minded personalities that share our passion for turning tremendous amounts of data into value for our customers and shareholders through real-time, data&insights-driven product, service and business innovation. We are looking for a Big Data Architect to contribute to this process by shaping big data architecture, data governance, and data-democratisation within Telenet.

If this sounds like a nice proposition, here’s what you should have in store for us, and what we will have in store for you…








At the Information Technology Department, we embrace digital possibilities and are always ready to make it happen. We make a difference by choosing change and leading-edge innovation in digital and data technology that provides solutions for internal and external customers. The impact of our work is huge, no matter how small it starts.

OCS & MVNE Solution Engineer
We open up a world of digital opportunities so people live better and work smarter.

Job Content

We are looking for a Solution Engineer to reinforce our team as MVNE expert. MVNE stands for Mobile Virtual Network Enabler and the MVNE platform is a platform that supports mobile virtual network operators (MVNOs) that are using the Proximus mobile network such as Scarlet and Astrid. The MVNE platform has an integrated Online Charging System (OCS) that enables the real-time rating of the mobile customers of these operators. The platform interacts with the voice, data and messaging network elements of the Proximus network. The MVNE platform also provides subscriber and mobile usage information to CRM and billing systems.

As MVNE Solution Engineer, you will be technically responsible for the MVNE platform, you will coordinate the MVNE projects and you will define the evolution of the MVNE service. As member of the OCS engineering team, you will support your colleagues for the rating of OCS related projects like Pay&Go, Epic or Mobilus.







A professional and stimulating working environment in the telecommunications sector. Various career opportunities within the Proximus Group on a national and international level, high-quality training and a rich and acknowledged expertise. We also offer you an attractive remuneration with many fringe benefits.

At Utensio you will

Cowboy is a Belgian startup that is developing innovative electric bikes for urban riders. Cowboy’s main goal is to improve urban mobility and take commuters to their destination in a more enjoyable, sustainable and efficient manner.

Founded in 2017 by entrepreneurs Adrien Roose, Karim Slaoui and Tanguy Goretti, Cowboy is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium. Cowboy is the winner of the Eurobike 2017, the Red-Dot bicycle design award 2018 and the Red-Dot “Best of the Best” award for the Cowboy 2.

With traffic congestion plaguing metropolitan areas, electric bikes are proving to be the fastest means of transportation, beating cars and ground public transport. Cowboy’s vision is to elevate the daily commute to the next level in terms of speed, comfort and freedom of movement around the city. Cowboy enhances the riding experience by unifying intelligent technology, delightful design and meticulous customer service.

Cowboy raised ten million EUR from international investors (including Index Ventures, Tiger Global and Hardware Club) in the Series A round in autumn 2018 and quickly sold out its entire stock of bikes in Belgium the following year. In April 2019, Cowboy launched its second model, the Cowboy 2, and introduced it to 8 additional countries (Germany, France, the Netherlands, Luxembourg, Austria, Italy, Spain and the United Kingdom). In June 2020, Cowboy unveiled its third generation electric bike, the Cowboy 3.



You will closely work with our Front-End and Back-End developers. You will be reporting directly to the CTO and a good chunk of your work will be to support our internal tools. It will be quite interesting as we are facing many complex challenges in logistics, remote repairs, distribution (test rides available in 60+ cities), manufacturing, data warehousing, testing, etc.

You will be talking to many people in the company to make sure we can reach our targets and take the company to the next level.

It's definitely not your classic marketplace / SaaS development.

Logical and analytical mind.

Team spirit.

8 € meal vouchers

100% coverage of public transport costs

Group insurance, hospitalization (inpatient, outpatient and dental)

Annual bonus…

We are located in the heart of the city of Brussels and can be reached by train, metro, tram, bus…

We are looking for a Senior System Engineer to expand our Data Networking team. The work area is mainly in Belgium - Brussels.

The prime function of this role is to design, deploy, operate and support Wired and Wireless Local Area Networks (LAN) solutions that will be provided either on customers' premises or through our data centre infrastructure.

The candidate must demonstrate his/her ability to deal with the networking technologies that are required to deploy such LAN/WLAN solutions. He/she must demonstrate his/her capacity to work in a standalone mode but at the same time he/she will be part of a team where communication and collaboration are key factors to success.

Strong communication skills, a POSITIVE ATTITUDE, and a COMPETITIVE, but TEAM ORIENTED focus are key elements to be successful in this challenging environment.

When the candidate can demonstrate that he/she is fulfilling the job expectations, he/she will get the required trainings to further evolve in this challenging function.

We are offering a challenging job in the ICT area within a company belonging to an international group. We also provide you with an attractive salary package including advantages such as Company car, mobile phone, Insurance ...

The senior system engineer will work in the Data Networking team and will be responsible for following tasks:




We are looking for a system engineer who already has 4 to 6 years of experience in deploying LAN and WLAN architectures and who is knowledgeable of the data networking technologies used in such an environment.

Collibra, explained

Today, organizations across all industries are using data for nearly every business decision, and the value of reliable, trustworthy data has grown exponentially as a way to gain competitive advantage. Collibra was built to be the system of record for all data professionals.
Our scalable, cloud-based platform provides people with a uniform view of their data landscape, independent of where or how the data is stored. This enables people to automate processes, find and understand their data, and trust the data to make confident, informed business decisions - something we call Data Intelligence.

As a leading telecommunications company with its two feet in the digitization of our society, Telenet is eager to bring aboard (big) data-minded personalities that share our passion for turning tremendous amounts of data into value for our customers and shareholders through real-time, data&insights-driven product, service and business innovation. We are looking for a Big Data Architect to contribute to this process by shaping big data architecture, data governance, and data-democratisation within Telenet.

If this sounds like a nice proposition, here’s what you should have in store for us, and what we will have in store for you…








In het Information Technology Department omarmen we de nieuw digitale mogelijkheden. Door altijd klaar te staan om in actie te schieten, te durven kiezen voor verandering en toonaangevende innovaties in digital en data technology maken we het verschil. Bouw mee aan de wereld van morgen! Treed op als consultant om klanten te begeleiden doorheen het project.

Je functie voorbereiding, onderzoeken, transformeren en analyseren van data interpretatie van trends/patronen in complexe datasets toepassen van statistische modellen en machine learning om inzichten te creëren en beslissingen te ondersteunen ontwikkelen van dashboards / visualisaties voor klanten begeleiden van de klant doorheen dit proces door middel van workshops en opleidingen . Strategisch meedenken met de klant om te bepalen waar meerwaarde kan gecreëerd worden door middel van data analytics. een aantal voorbeelden van projecten waaraan jij zou kunnen meewerken: predictive maintenance applicaties, anomalie detectie, object herkenning via computer vision, etc. Heel wat projecten situeren zich in de context van industrie 4.0, smart products en IoT.



Je profiel

Master burgerlijk/industrieel ingenieur, computer science, wiskunde of in een andere IT-richting reeds je strepen verdiend in Python, Tensorflow en AI platformen (bijv Azure, Watson) kennis van Power BI of Java zijn een troef goed zicht op de basistechnieken in data science (classificatie, regressie, deep learning, data structuren,…) gedreven, analytisch en ‘hands-on’ approach Goede kennis Engels, Frans is een plus. Je beschikt over een rijbewijs B Interim-, selectie- en rekruteringskantoren gelieve zich te onthouden van deze functie. Bij voorstellingen zijn VINCI Energies en haar dochterbedrijven niet gebonden tot aanwerving onder interim-, selectie- of rekruteringsvoorwaarden.

WeSmart is looking

for data scientists to synthesize and leverage our massive dataset of energy data to enhance solution analysis.
This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals destined to change the face of energy and IOT data management. We are focused on the company’s agenda, and work on high-impact projects utilizing big data analytics and machine learning to improve energy solutions.

We’re a lean, flat and experimental team combining science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into energy management processes at their point of highest impact. The team works in quick iterations, using the techniques and algorithms best suited for solving the challenging problems of energy management.



You will advocate, evangelize and build data-fuelled products that help our customers improve energy solutions. You’ll dig in and become an expert on our energy and IOT datasets. You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.

You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. You will lead applied analytics initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions for energy management. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.

As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.



You’re passionate about asking and answering questions in large datasets, and you are able to communicate that passion to product managers and engineers. You have a keen desire to solve business problems, and live to find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data. You propose analytics strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around you.

You desire a fast paced, test-driven, collaborative and iterative engineering environment. You love learning, data, scale and agility. You excel at making complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you. You’re driven to show the world the power of applied analytics.

The Zeus 2.0 program addresses the evolving challenges the company is facing in the management and exploitation of Scientific data in an era of increasing data volumes, data types, tests complexity and new methods of data exploitation. body:
WeSmart is looking

for data scientists to synthesize and leverage our massive dataset of energy data to enhance solution analysis.
This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals destined to change the face of energy and IOT data management. We are focused on the company’s agenda, and work on high-impact projects utilizing big data analytics and machine learning to improve energy solutions.

We’re a lean, flat and experimental team combining science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into energy management processes at their point of highest impact. The team works in quick iterations, using the techniques and algorithms best suited for solving the challenging problems of energy management.



You will advocate, evangelize and build data-fuelled products that help our customers improve energy solutions. You’ll dig in and become an expert on our energy and IOT datasets. You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.

You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. You will lead applied analytics initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions for energy management. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.

As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.



You’re passionate about asking and answering questions in large datasets, and you are able to communicate that passion to product managers and engineers. You have a keen desire to solve business problems, and live to find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data. You propose analytics strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around you.

You desire a fast paced, test-driven, collaborative and iterative engineering environment. You love learning, data, scale and agility. You excel at making complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you. You’re driven to show the world the power of applied analytics.

Wat kan je?
Big Data, Python
WO denkniveau
Senior, Medior, Lead werkniveau

Wat krijg je?

Wat doe je?

De vacature

As the data revolution continues in full force, companies across different industries are focusing on leveraging the value of their data. At dataSHIFT we are looking for a senior data scientist to help these companies achieve impactful results.

You will be part of a multidiscliplinary team with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. In your role as data scientist you will be responsible for translating various business needs into scalable analytical solutions. You like to learn and can easily adapt to a fast-changing environment. You enjoy using your creativity when facing complex problems.;

body:
Compass Lexecon is one of the world’s leading economic consultancy firms. Our European Practices provide economic advice on competition policy, economic and financial regulation, public policy and the assessment of damages in complex disputes. We work on some of the most high-profile cases before the European Commission, the General Court and national competition authorities, regulators and courts.



Compass Lexecon is recruiting Data Scientists to join the newly created Research Team. Data is a core part of every project at Compass Lexecon, and turning that data into compelling empirical analysis is fundamental to what we do. With increasing amounts of data being generated and made available, there are exciting opportunities to apply tools from data science, machine learning, and data engineering to the challenging policy and competition questions that arise in our work.



The team aims to (a) advance our thought leadership in the industry by introducing new tools and techniques to address challenges encountered in economic consulting, bringing Compass Lexecon to the forefront of data analytics, and (b) broaden and deepen all Compass Lexecon economists’ specialist skillsets to offer our clients the most effective, creative and cutting-edge analysis and advice. In doing so, we aim to push the frontier of how data is used to shape markets in some of the world’s most important industries.

As a data scientist in the Research Team, you will help bring this vision to life.

The role


You should apply if


We believe that working in diverse teams, where everybody’s views are considered and respected, helps us to deliver work of the highest standards of quality and integrity.

London, Paris, Brussels, Madrid, Berlin, Düsseldorf, Helsinki, Tel Aviv. /

Research Team /

Full time, permanent

We're Ushering a New Era of Data Participation. Interested?

We’re shaping the way companies manage data by helping customers connect the right data, insights, and algorithms for all Data Citizens. When everyone across the organization is enabled with data, true transformation can take place. We are building a team of exceptional people to help us deliver on that promise. If you are interested in a career at the leading edge of technology, we look forward to hearing from you.

Its core functionality is , and like data flows, joined columns, filters, etc. In the near future the scanner needs to process also programming languages like Python and Java. At the same time, you will help Collibra products transition to complete SaaS model.

Besides challenging coding responsibilities, you will also be person in their delivery cycles, efforts and overall architecture tasks.

Your work will have a positive impact on companies and developers maintaining a legacy codebase. A common scenario is that a Data Warehousing team in a larger enterprise company ends up with 1m+ lines of legacy code. Value proposition and motto of the team you will lead is “We need 10 minutes to document 10 years of your development”.

This job is a perfect fit if you enjoy functional programming and you wish to work with a unique team and great technical challenges!

Work in a Scrum team of 6 people Deliver a self-service BI model for the wider organisation Build, test, maintain and document ETL processes and data models Visualize business data needs with one of our reporting tools Support decision making in data related topics Support data analyst in capturing data needs from our internal clients You have experience in Data Warehousing, Data Modelling, Database Design, ETL You have knowledge of the AWS suite, such as AW...

Job Description

As a leading telecommunications company with its two feet in the digitization of our society, Telenet is eager to bring aboard (big) data-minded personalities that share our passion for turning tremendous amounts of for our customers and shareholders through . We are looking for a Big Data Engineer to contribute to this process

If this sounds like a nice proposition, here’s what you should have in store for us, and what we will have in store for you…







Start a new adventure in the beating heart of our data driven organization. We keep an eye out for talent, ambition and eagerness to learn. We’ll coach you, train you and make you part of our story. Moreover, we will offer you an attractive wage and benefits package. Come experience it for yourself, our passion is contagious.

Job Description

Job Description

At Levi Strauss & Co, we are revolutionizing the apparel business and redefining the way denim is made.

We are taking one of the world’s most iconic brands into the next century: from creating machine learning-powered denim finishes to using block-chain for our factory workers’ wellbeing, to building algorithms to better meet the needs of our consumers and optimize our supply chain.

Be a pioneer in the fashion industry by joining our global Data, Analytics & AI “startup with assets,” where you will have the chance to build exciting solutions that will impact our European business and at the same time be part of a bigger, across-continents, data community.

We are looking for aData engineerbased in our European headquarter in Diegem, Belgium.In this role you will build a solid data foundation that powers the entire spectrum from Business Intelligence to Artificial Intelligence. You’ll be critical to helping us in our transition from batch to real-time, one-to-one to many-to-many connections, centrally-managed infrastructure to self-service tools that allow easy experimentation, and from manual to automated processes. You'll report to the European Leadfor Data Analytics & AI.

Youwill work closely with the Data Science and AI team and focus on enablement and acceleration of new and existing workflows. You are someone who will bring thoughtful perspective, empathy, creativity, and a positive attitude to solve problems at scale; andlooking to extend software engineering skills into the field of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.







LOCATIONZaventem, BelgiumFULL TIME/PART TIMEFull time

job title: AWS Data Engineer/ Serverless & Data Lakes / Brussels & Antwerp
body:
AWS Data Engineer

Serverless & Data Lakes

Antwerp & Brussels



We are looking for pragmatic AWS Serverless Data Engineers to join this team and help in the most high-level serverless data lake implementation on AWS in Belgium. The team is small but extremely powerful, exclusively AWS specialised, and have a grandiose vision for the future. The clients are the ones that are leading in AI transformation, and you will be part of it!

job title: Site Reliability Engineer - Unicorn SaaS Product Development
body:
Site Reliability Engineer

Brussels Area

A Unicorn Product-Based Company and Data Governance Specialists that became an AWS Partner

This is a highly successful, fast-growing, and globally awarded SaaS organization. Their technical solutions recognized and validated by AWS, their offices are in six different countries and three different continents, the I.T society refers to them as "Unicorns".

So for my Unicorn client, I'm looking for a Site Reliability Engineer who knows the importance and the difference between SLO/SLI to work closely with the product developers and continuously ensure that the platform's new features have the proper operational support and maintainability.

We will discuss the rest of your responsibilities together over the phone that we'll arrange right after you finish reading the following lines.

Why you and your new team are so important



❏ Become better at Observability (starting from a good base of monitoring & logging their application, then going beyond that with the unknowns).
❏ Creating a frictionless process for incident management & proper post mortem follow up.
❏ Help the teams understand and coach to build and maintain operable software that they design.



➔ Big love for feedback loops in regards to observability (monitoring, logging, tracing)
◆ They use modern observability tools, such as Grafana, Datadog, Prometheus...
➔ You either come from a solid background in developing (preferably Java) or System engineering. In both cases, you can also do scripting (Python/GO)
◆ In any case, Linux brings you some sort of joy
➔ You're familiar with cloud-native apps and distributed systems ;
➔ Solid knowledge of Amazon Web Services and/or Google Cloud Platform with a focus on services monitoring;

➔ The following words and concepts bring a smile on your face: IaC, CI/CD, Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes

And regarding personality, aka "Soft Skills"
➔ A troubleshooter's mindset and pragmatic to fixing it
➔ Strong communication skills and the ability to coach and support teams to make tomorrow better than today
➔ You are not happy with the status quo and want to push forward. But you always agree when your manager urges that "we need to have a stable system"

Are you asking what else they are offering in addition to a competitive salary, benefits package, and equity? Hold my beer...

❏ The opportunity to make a great impact on the company, by joining it in its most robust period: the creation of a great enterprise platform.
❏ The opportunity to work in an agile and startup-minded environment surrounded by highly skilled professionals that are all using cutting edge tech, where your contribution is appreciated and your personal and career growth is guaranteed.
❏ Quality > Quantity so you should expect flexible working hours and not a typical 9 - 5 schedule.

Contact
Now that you know so much, you Better Call Paul (that's me, Pavlos Diamantopoulos) at +32 2808 2878 or write an e-mail at p.diamantopoulos@jeffersonfrank.com

body: StepStone is one of the largest job sites in Europe and the secret of this success is mainly due to two factors: quality products and above all, passionate and talented people! For our international data science team, we are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer. We have the mission to leverage data driven decision making and innovation in all business areas of StepStone. We have backgrounds in different quantitative disciplines and share the conviction that the right combination of data, technology, and smart algorithms is key. With your software development skills, you will support the design & implementation of robust & fast machine learning solutions. You will collaborate closely with both data scientists and data engineers. With your knowledge of both methodology and technology, you will help to deploy machine learning models at scale. You will team up with data scientists and data engineers, contributing to various exciting data science projects and products You will ...

Contexte

Acteur majeur de la Business Intelligence depuis 2002, BGFi a développé son savoir-faire dans le domaine Data & Analytics. Avec plus de 200 consultants à travers l’Europe et l’Asie, nous nous assurons que nos clients (startups, PME, groupes internationaux) dans tous les secteurs d’activité sont dotés de solutions analytiques innovantes. Pour devenir un véritable partenaire technologique, des partenariats ont été mis en place avec IBM, Microsoft, Tableau, SAS, AWS et Alteryx. Aujourd’hui, nous proposons des solutions basées sur 3 piliers : Data Management (Master Data Management, Data Quality et Data Governance), Data Engineering (ETL, Data warehousing, Data lakes, Plateformes analytiques et Reporting) et Advanced Analytics (Self-service Analytics, Data Preparation, Data Vizualization and Data Science).

BGFi est à la recherche d’un Ingénieur Data à fort potentiel qui souhaite se positionner comme un référent dans son domaine et relever de nouveaux défis.

Description du poste

En tant que Data Engineer, vous avez l’opportunité de vous investir dans des projets stimulants, de collecter des données et de créer des data pipeline, ayant un impact réel sur l’intégration des solutions et aidant les entreprises dans leurs stratégies.

Vous serez en mesure de construire et de diriger une communauté Analytics, en partageant des conseils et des bonnes pratiques avec vos collègues Positive Thinkers. Vous pouvez également animer des ateliers, dispenser des coachings et des formations à des consultants plus juniors. En résumé, vous avez une réelle valeur ajoutée dans l’équipe, en partageant et en acquérant des connaissances en travaillant avec des Data Scientists, des Analystes BI, des développeurs et en travaillant sur notre Data Factory.

Avantages

Notre esprit positif se veut orienté vers la recherche de solutions et se concentre sur la performance collaborative. Pour ce faire, BGFi vous forme aux compétences techniques en offrant l’accès à des licences, telles que Datacamp et Coursera. Nous vous formons également à de nombreuses méthodologies et aux compétences managériales.

Nous investissons dans votre évolution pour assumer des rôles clés dans le développement de notre équipe Data & Analytics. Nous vous mettons au défi de développer vos compétences dans divers projets et environnements, en bénéficiant de mentorats sur mesure, d’ateliers, de certifications et de formations personnalisées. De plus, rejoindre BGFi, c’est aussi prendre en charge votre évolution dans différents domaines : Data Science, Data Architecture ou Project Management, à vous de voir 😉.

Compétences requises

En tant que Positive Thinker désireux de rejoindre notre équipe, vous devez être titulaire d’un Master en informatique, en analytique ou dans tout autre domaine connexe. La communication dans des environnements multiculturels est essentielle, vous avez donc d’excellentes compétences linguistiques en anglais et en français ou en néerlandais. En tant que Data Engineer, vous avez une forte expérience dans le Data Mining, les outils de Data Processing (Kafka, Spark, etc.), les bases de données NoSQL et les architectures distribuées (Hadoop, Cloudera, Hortonworks).

Vous voulez travailler dans un écosystème technologique innovant ? Postulez dès maintenant 😊

Job Description

Key tasks & responsibilities

Formalize adoption of an Enterprise Data Governance Strategy


Profile

Description

You will be part of the Advanced Analytics Center of Expertise, a centralized team of data scientists that is supporting different business units within the company. You will transform data into actionable insights that drive operational processes or influence strategic decisions. Use cases cover various domains such as predictive maintenance, network optimization, customer relationship management and natural language processing.

A Typical Week

Job Description

(vertaling volgt)

It’s our day to day mission to work together with our customers to provide a reliable & flexible platform as a foundation to host new applications and products. In your role as a Big Data Systems Engineer, you’ll be part of a team that sits in a driving seat to define and wire all data components together. It is exactly this diversity of technologies and stakeholders in a telecom context what makes this challenging and exciting.

If this sounds like a nice proposition, here’s what you should have in store for us. Hope to welcome you in our dynamic team full of opportunities to help you grow in your job.

TASKS

WE SEEK

You have a professional bachelor in computer science or similar by experience.

You have specific experience in deploying, maintaining and monitoring robust stream processing architectures built on Cloudera technology.

Ideally you know your way around related existing and upcoming Big Data technologies (Hadoop stack - Cloudera, Spark, Kafka, Sentry, Jupyter, Lenses, … ).

You are willing to invest time and effort to learn new technologies.

You have knowledge of Linux, Kerberos and automation tools such as Puppet or Ansible.

You feel at ease with scripting (Bash, Python).

and by nature you are

You always think and act with the client in mind.

You know how to prioritize and organize your work.

You are open to ideas and share yours with colleagues in a respectful way; you can work in group, but also individually.

You’re an excellent communicator and problem solver.

You constantly maintain an overview of the technology landscape

You’re willing to execute interventions outside business hours.

job title: Site Reliability Engineer - SaaS Product Development - AWS APN
body:
Site Reliability Engineer

Brussels Area

A Unicorn Product-Based Company and Data Governance Specialists that became an AWS Partner

This is a highly successful, fast-growing, and globally awarded SaaS organization. Their technical solutions recognized and validated by AWS, their offices are in six different countries and three different continents, the I.T society refers to them as "Unicorns".

So for my Unicorn client, I'm looking for a Site Reliability Engineer who knows the importance and the difference between SLO/SLI to work closely with the product developers and continuously ensure that the platform's new features have the proper operational support and maintainability.

We will discuss the rest of your responsibilities together over the phone that we'll arrange right after you finish reading the following lines.

Why you and your new team are so important



❏ Become better at Observability (starting from a good base of monitoring & logging their application, then going beyond that with the unknowns).
❏ Creating a frictionless process for incident management & proper post mortem follow up.
❏ Help the teams understand and coach to build and maintain operable software that they design.



➔ Big love for feedback loops in regards to observability (monitoring, logging, tracing)
◆ They use modern observability tools, such as Grafana, Datadog, Prometheus...
➔ You either come from a solid background in developing (preferably Java) or System engineering. In both cases, you can also do scripting (Python/GO)
◆ In any case, Linux brings you some sort of joy
➔ You're familiar with cloud-native apps and distributed systems ;
➔ Solid knowledge of Amazon Web Services and/or Google Cloud Platform with a focus on services monitoring;

➔ The following words and concepts bring a smile on your face: IaC, CI/CD, Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes

And regarding personality, aka "Soft Skills"
➔ A troubleshooter's mindset and pragmatic to fixing it
➔ Strong communication skills and the ability to coach and support teams to make tomorrow better than today
➔ You are not happy with the status quo and want to push forward. But you always agree when your manager urges that "we need to have a stable system"

Are you asking what else they are offering in addition to a competitive salary, benefits package, and equity? Hold my beer...

❏ The opportunity to make a great impact on the company, by joining it in its most robust period: the creation of a great enterprise platform.
❏ The opportunity to work in an agile and startup-minded environment surrounded by highly skilled professionals that are all using cutting edge tech, where your contribution is appreciated and your personal and career growth is guaranteed.
❏ Quality > Quantity so you should expect flexible working hours and not a typical 9 - 5 schedule.

Contact
Now that you know so much, you Better Call Paul (that's me, Pavlos Diamantopoulos) at +32 2808 2878 or write an e-mail at p.diamantopoulos@jeffersonfrank.com

Our team of seasoned professionals has extensive Business and IT experience in digital transformation programs and can provide unbiased advice as we are 100% independent & tool/vendor agnostic. This allows us to select the best-in-market solution(s) for your specific challenges and opportunities. Personalized solutions improving the customer experience of your organization is what we strive for.

Experience Dutch speaking Data Scientist required for a 6 month contract based in Brussels. Public Sector.

Daily rate: 500 Euros per day









Preferably, you have work experience with the end-to-end data science project life cycle, including:

Please apply for further details on this not to be missed contract opportunity.

This is an exciting time for our company! We are in full transition from a European leading service provider of airport equipment solutions to a global leader.

Your role

As a Data Engineer you report to the IT Director. You are based at our headquarters in Steenokkerzeel. You help the Application team in achieving the Information System objectives, with a focus on Database and Business Intelligence administration. TCR’s Business Applications landscape is business critical, quite complex and comprehensive; it consists of multiple applications running on Microsoft SQL databases.

For this position, we are looking for a highly motivated colleague who loves a fast-paced environment and international contacts. Next to this you are a talent in problem solving and you are detail oriented. You learn fast.

You will be supporting our business by being responsible for:







TCR is active in 5 continents and 20 countries. We have more than 70 workshops and 1,300 employees. We are a stable company that continues to grow year after year. To support this expansion, we are always looking for new talent. Are you an expert in your field? At TCR we guarantee that you can use your capacities to the maximum extent.

We always want to get the best out of our people. At TCR you can become an expert in your field. We support knowledge and motivate our employees to constantly improve themselves. We offer appropriate training and many challenges.

We are serious when we have to be, but we also have fun when we can. At TCR, we address people by their first names and we can count on each other. We take pride in the great diversity of people in our company and always put equality first, regardless of age, gender, background, culture or origin.

TCR creates an environment in which an expert performs best. That is why we offer all our employees the best possible working conditions: a competitive salary based on experience and qualifications, attractive working hours and additional benefits such as meal vouchers and insurances.

WeSmart is looking

for a senior data scientist to synthesize and leverage our massive dataset of energy data to enhance solution analysis. This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals destined to change the face of energy and IOT data management. We are focused on the company’s agenda, and work on high-impact projects utilizing big data analytics and machine learning to improve energy solutions. We’re a lean, flat and experimental team combining science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into energy management processes at their point of highest impact. The team works in quick iterations, using the techniques and algorithms best suited for solving the challenging problems of energy management.



You will advocate, evangelise and build data-fueled products that help our customers improve energy solutions. You’ll dig in and become an expert on energy and IOT datasets. You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.

You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritise actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas for WeSmart but also for our customers. You will lead applied analytics initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions for energy management. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyse diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.

As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organisation.



You’re passionate about asking and answering questions in large datasets, and you are able to communicate that passion to product managers and engineers. You have a keen desire to solve business problems, and live to find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data. You propose analytics strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around you. You desire a fast paced, test-driven, collaborative and iterative engineering environment. You love learning, data, scale and agility. You excel at making complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you. You’re driven to show the world the power of applied analytics.



Master or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research or any related field A minimum of 4 years of working experience as a data scientist or in analytics Strong programming skills such as Java and/or Python Minimum of 2 years’ experience in machine learning Minimum of 2 years’ experience in team management Knowledge of statistical tools such SAS, R, Matlab, … is required Professional experience in the energy sector is preferred Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong analytical competencies and excellent creative problem-solving skills Fluent in French and English

Company & Department Description

Working for SWIFT means working at the heart of the financial services industry, an industry were business challenges and opportunities grow every day.

At SWIFT, we see Professional Services as a means to help our customers adhere to regulation, reduce costs and risks, streamline and ensure smooth operations, improve our customer's experience and/or develop their staff to the level they need.

Our goal is to help our customers use SWIFT in the best way possible and excel faster.

In the Services Enablement and Customer Operations department, we are providing shared services to the Professional Services delivery organization and the commercial teams to define and manage the services portfolio, ensure correct delivery of services packages and ensure correct revenue recognition of payable services.

In support of this, the Service analytics and reporting team, within Services Marketing and Engineering is hiring a Data Engineer to set up and improve data streams to a central data hub, from which service delivery performance data can be analyzed. The Data Engineer will be taking care of preparing the big data infrastructure to be analyzed by data scientist.

The job requires close collaboration with the regional services delivery teams, with an initial focus on consulting and professional services. Key tasks include the definition of design, build and integrate data pipes from multiple sources where services data is available, but not exploitable today. In collaboration with the team, the Data Engineer will need data ingestion rules and data management tools, so that large amounts of data can be analyzed by our business analysts and data scientists.

This is a unique opportunity for a team player who likes a complex and challenging environment and wants to develop her/his big data engineering and mining skills, as well as networking skills to deliver top quality work with impact on the future of a world-class customer services.



Your main responsibilities will be:

Contexte

Acteur majeur de la Business Intelligence depuis 2002, BGFi a développé son savoir-faire dans le domaine Data & Analytics. Avec plus de 200 consultants à travers l’Europe et l’Asie, nous nous assurons que nos clients (startups, PME, groupes internationaux) dans tous les secteurs d’activité sont dotés de solutions analytiques innovantes. Pour devenir un véritable partenaire technologique, des partenariats ont été mis en place avec IBM, Microsoft, Tableau, SAS, AWS et Alteryx. Aujourd’hui, nous proposons des solutions basées sur 3 piliers : Data Management (Master Data Management, Data Quality et Data Governance), Data Engineering (ETL, Data warehousing, Data lakes, Plateformes analytiques et Reporting) et Advanced Analytics (Self-service Analytics, Data Preparation, Data Vizualization and Data Science).

BGFi est à la recherche d’un Data Scientist pour rejoindre notre équipe et se lancer un nouveau challenge en tant que consultant.

Description du poste

En tant que Data Scientist, vous avez l’opportunité de rejoindre nos équipes qui sont quotidiennement confrontées à des défis dans des environnements technologiques très exigeants. Vous travaillerez sur des projets innovants directement chez nos clients, en apportant votre expertise et vos compétences sur leurs projets en cours dans leurs départements R&D, Data et Marketing.

En plus de cela, vous pourriez être impliqué sur nos projets internes «Data Factory» où nous développons nos propres solutions. Notre département est en plein essor et la création d’une «Data Factory» est l’expression de notre ambition de croître et d’être une référence sur le marché de l’Analytique au Benelux. Vous aurez l’occasion de créer, de développer vos idées, d’évoluer rapidement et d’assumer un poste de responsable technique. Participez simplement à cette aventure palpitante.

Avantages

En rejoignant l’écosystème de la Positive Thinking Company, vous bénéficierez d’un parcours de carrière personnalisé et d’un suivi RH tous les 3 mois ! Notre objectif est de vous aider à développer vos compétences et à évoluer sur différents postes (techniques, managériaux ou analytiques) grâce à des tutorats sur mesure, des ateliers, des e-learning (Datacamp, Coursera et Pluralsight) et des certifications. Vous pourrez rejoindre nos communautés autour de sujets analytiques ou créer une communauté où des Positive Thinkers passionnés partageront la connaissance.

Parlez-nous simplement de votre rêve et nous ferons tout pour qu’il devienne réalité !

Compétences requises

En tant que Positive Thinker désireux de rejoindre notre équipe, vous êtes titulaire d’un Master ou d’un Doctorat en informatique, statistique ou économie. Vous parlez français ou néerlandais et anglais. Vous serez le candidat idéal si vous êtes familier avec Python et/ou R, les statistiques (tests d’hypothèses, statistiques sommaires, etc.), Machine Learning et les outils et techniques d’IA (k-nearest neighbors, random forests, ensemble methods, clustering, regression, neural networks…).Enfin, nous allons bien nous entendre si votre travail est votre passion, si vous êtes à la pointe des technologies et si vous partagez nos valeurs : performance collaborative, transparence, ouverture d’esprit et recherche de solutions.

N’y pensez pas à deux fois, postulez !

Wat kan je?
Big Data, BI
HBO, Bachelor, Master denkniveau
Medior werkniveau

Wat krijg je?

Wat doe je?

De vacature

As a Data Engineer you will be working on implementing complex and large scale big data projects with a focus on collecting, parsing, managing, analyzing and visualizing large datasets to turn raw data into insights using multiple toolsets, techniques and cloud based platforms.

Functie eisen

We are looking for people who are passionate about new technology and are open to share their knowledge with their colleagues and clients. A positive attitude is everything.

Senior/Expert Data Scientist - M/F/X
Want to help shape the bank of tomorrow today?
At the bank for a changing world, our employees make change their greatest asset, turning challenges into opportunities. They think ahead to offer our customers creative solutions which are perfectly suited to their needs. At BNP Paribas Fortis, the country's number one bank, employees enjoy ongoing career growth in a meaningful, rewarding and flexible working environment.
The A&AI tribe (Analytics & Artificial Intelligence) has the objective of transforming data into valuable information to improve business. We are looking for someone with a strong understanding of the challenges related to this field to join our team.





As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to apply and develop your skills in several domains

The A& AI tribe is looking for a Senior Data Scientist (seniority rhymes with knowledge and experience) with a proven track record in the field of Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence and innovation.





You take pride in the following knowledge and experience that you have already acquired, which are indispensable for this role.

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values. At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain women and men of all ages, from all backgrounds, each with her or his own experience. We truly believe that diversity increases performance and creativity. All our offers for full-time positions are also available for 90% or 80% full-time equivalent.


We believe that our evolution is driven and inspired by our employees. In return, we aim to provide optimal working conditions that enable you to develop on both a professional and personal level. We offer a challenging working environment in which you are going to have a real impact within our company. You can actively shape your benefit package to respond to your individual needs.


Passionate about this role? Do not hesitate to apply online: we'd love to hear from you!

anderzijds ben je betrokken bij innovatieve pilots en projecten op het gebied van data gedreven werken.
